meanings.definition: A piece of information or a story passed from one person to another without any proof that it is true.
examples: We heard a rumor that school would close early today, but it didn't.

images.alt: Photo of one person whispering into the ear of another person.
images.description: One person whispers into the ear of another person.
images.caption: Rumors spread from one person to another.

meanings.definition: Related to the body, not the mind; involving bodily contact.
examples: He did hard physical training to prepare for the race.

images.alt: Photo of young man exercising on stairs.
images.description: Photo of young man getting exercise on stairs.
images.caption: Stretching is a way to get into good physical shape.

source.title: Young ethnic focused sportsman exercising on stairs in city
source.author: Andrea Piacquadio

examples: One in three adolescents is physically, emotionally, or verbally abused by a dating partner.

images.alt: Illustration of a person with a fist coming from his mouth.
images.description: An artistic representation of verbal abuse. A fist extends out of one person's mouth and hits another person.
images.caption: This representation of verbal abuse shows the damaging impact of words.

meanings.definition: Someone who is hurt, injured, or killed by a person, group, or event.
examples: They were victims of unfair treatment by others.

images.alt: Photo of fist in the foreground and person sitting on the ground.
images.description: A person stands with a clenched fist in the foreground. A person sits with head down and hands over head in the background.
images.caption: Victims can be hurt physically, through words, or other actions.

source.title: Man in Yellow Shirt and Blue Denim Jeans
source.author: Karolina Grabowska

meanings.definition: A general review, summary, or survey, as of a subject or situation.
examples: The teacher gave an overview of the main ideas before the students read the chapter.
